metadata.Title: CVE-2022-39399 on Ubuntu 18.04 ESM (bionic) - medium
metadata.Description:
Vulnerability in the Oracle Java SE, Oracle GraalVM Enterprise Editionproduct of Oracle Java SE (component: Networking). Supported versions thatare affected are Oracle Java SE: 11.0.16.1, 17.0.4.1, 19; Oracle GraalVMEnterprise Edition: 20.3.7, 21.3.3 and 22.2.0. Difficult to exploitvulnerability allows unauthenticated attacker with network access via HTTPto compromise Oracle Java SE, Oracle GraalVM Enterprise Edition. Successfulattacks of this vulnerability can result in unauthorized update, insert ordelete access to some of Oracle Java SE, Oracle GraalVM Enterprise Editionaccessible data. Note: This vulnerability applies to Java deployments,typically in clients running sandboxed Java Web Start applications orsandboxed Java applets, that load and run untrusted code (e.g., code thatcomes from the internet) and rely on the Java sandbox for security. Thisvulnerability does not apply to Java deployments, typically in servers,that load and run only trusted code (e.g., code installed by anadministrator). CVSS 3.1 Base Score 3.7 (Integrity impacts). CVSS Vector:(CVSS:3.1/AV:N/AC:H/PR:N/UI:N/S:U/C:N/I:L/A:N).

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2022-39399` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

openjdk-11-demo - 11.0.17+8-1ubuntu2~18.04
openjdk-11-jdk - 11.0.17+8-1ubuntu2~18.04
openjdk-11-jdk-headless - 11.0.17+8-1ubuntu2~18.04
openjdk-11-jre - 11.0.17+8-1ubuntu2~18.04
openjdk-11-jre-headless - 11.0.17+8-1ubuntu2~18.04
openjdk-11-jre-zero - 11.0.17+8-1ubuntu2~18.04
openjdk-11-source - 11.0.17+8-1ubuntu2~18.04
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

openjdk-17-demo - 17.0.5+8-2ubuntu1~18.04
openjdk-17-jdk - 17.0.5+8-2ubuntu1~18.04
openjdk-17-jdk-headless - 17.0.5+8-2ubuntu1~18.04
openjdk-17-jre - 17.0.5+8-2ubuntu1~18.04
openjdk-17-jre-headless - 17.0.5+8-2ubuntu1~18.04
openjdk-17-jre-zero - 17.0.5+8-2ubuntu1~18.04
openjdk-17-source - 17.0.5+8-2ubuntu1~18.04
No subscription required

criterions.comment: openjdk-lts package in esm-infra/bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '11.0.17+8-1ubuntu2~18.04').
openjdk-17 package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '17.0.5+8-2ubuntu1~18.04').
